greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of theta_3(q)*theta_3(q^2)*theta_4(q^8) in powers of q.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) := Product_{k>=1} (1-(-q)^k) (see A121373), phi(q) := theta_3(q) := Sum_{k=-oo..oo} q^(k^2) (A000122), psi(q) := Sum_{k=0..oo} q^(k*(k+1)/2) (A010054), chi(q) := Product_{k>=0} (1+q^(2k+1)) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of (eta(q^2)*eta(q^4))^3/(eta(q)^2*eta(q^16)) in powers of q.
Expansion of phi(q)phi(q^2)phi(-q^8) in powers of q where phi() is a Ramanujan theta function.
mathematica: eta[q_] := q^(1/24)*QPochhammer[q]; a[n_]:= SeriesCoefficient[ (eta[q^2]*eta[q^4])^3/(eta[q]^2*eta[q^16]), {q,0,n}]; Table[a[n], {n,0,50}] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Feb 11 2018 *)
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Feb 28 2003
